definition: good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~

sentences.english: I think you should just admit that you're a big softy .
sentences.chinese: 呃，我觉得你得承认自己挺多愁善感。

sentences.english: If they overdo it, then we say they are sentimental.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们做的过分了，我们就说他们很多愁善感。

sentences.english: Maybe, it's just because of you.
sentences.chinese: 还是你的理智淹没了我的善感。

sentences.english: Emotionalism and sentimentality prevent the sensitivity of feeling.
sentences.chinese: 多愁善感和感情用事妨碍了感觉的敏锐。

sentences.english: I don't want to go on loving sentimentally any more like now. I want my friendship.
sentences.chinese: 我不想再这样多愁善感地爱下去，我要我的友谊。

sentences.english: Although sometimes some woman. she inside, but is a little sentimentality.
sentences.chinese: 虽然有时也有些大大咧咧，但是内心却有点多愁善感。

sentences.english: I am a delicate girl in bone, maybe it is the only springhead.
sentences.chinese: 我骨子里就是个多愁善感的女孩，这是唯一的根源。

sentences.english: That sentimental girl likes to pick up the fallen petals on the ground in autumn.
sentences.chinese: 那个多愁善感的女孩喜欢在秋天里拾起地上的落英。

sentences.english: I think you're kind of sentimental.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得你有点多情善感。

sentences.english: While she is much weak, she also grovels in sentimentality.
sentences.chinese: 她身体瀛弱，而且多愁善感。

sentences.english: Men of feeling may at any moment be killed outright by the iniquitous and the callous.
sentences.chinese: 多愁善感的人会立即被罪恶的人和无情的人彻底消灭。

sentences.english: That is part of what I mean by sentimentality.
sentences.chinese: 这就是我说的多愁善感的一部分。

sentences.english: In fact, I believe honest curiosity leads to compassion.
sentences.chinese: 事实上我认为，真正的好奇心是通向善感的。

sentences.english: He has a strong dislike for the sentimental.
sentences.chinese: 他非常讨厌多愁善感无病呻吟。

sentences.english: Anna: Why do you become so maudlin ?
sentences.chinese: 你为何变得如此多愁善感？

definition: lit. silly people get their panties in a bunch (idiom)/fig. to get upset over nothing/to make problems for oneself
scene which recalls past memories (idiom)/evocative of the past/reminiscent/to arouse deep feelings
lit. looking at one's shadow and feeling sorry for oneself (idiom)/fig. alone and dejected
